_header: Avaunce thee Hope as mine affiance
_description:
Comfort from Hope, a carole translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 250) — 22 lines in quatrains, two with additional line refrain

BLHar682.First Lines:
AVaunce thee hope as myn affyaunceComfort my hert now in his grevous
                    woo…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…The prison of daunger his cursid fooOr he must die in payne
                    and displesaunceAvaunce thee hope
